definition: lit. ready to appear at the call (idiom)/fig. on the verge of coming out into the open/(of a person's choice etc) on the point of being disclosed/(of an artistic depiction) vividly portrayed
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Your lips are of be vividly portrayed spring.
sentences.chinese: 你的脣邊是呼之欲出的春天。

sentences.english: Some academics expect Chinese earliest"Administrative Procedural law"was published in 2010.
sentences.chinese: 我國的《行政程序法》已經是呼之欲出而始終未出。

sentences.english: Inside every China sceptic is a prophet of the New Yellow Peril waiting to be let out.
sentences.chinese: 每個中國懷疑論者都有一個呼之欲出的新黃禍的預言。

sentences.english: Subjectivity education presents itself in the process of reflecting education.
sentences.chinese: 主體性教育在反思教育的進程中呼之欲出。

sentences.english: The idea here is to make your breasts look like they are going to pop out of your clothes.
sentences.chinese: 這樣就能讓你的胸看起來呼之欲出。

definition: to present clearly/to give prominence to/to magnify/clear and obvious
to come to prominence/to appear clearly/to stick out
conspicuous/to make sth stand out/make sth prominent
faintly discernible (idiom)
to let one's imagination roam
to expose/to reveal
to become visible/to reveal
completely/fully/without omission
to wait for action after having accumulated power, energy etc
bright/clear/obvious/forthright/open-minded/bright and cheerful
to appear vividly on paper (idiom); to show forth vividly (in writing, painting etc)/to stand out markedly
to draw the outline of/to outline/to sketch/to delineate contours of/to give a brief account of
attractive/alluring/captivating/to attract/to captivate
ample/complete/hundred percent/a pure shade (of some color)
to float up (idiom); to become evident/to surface/to appear
to show forth/to appear as a vivid image/to stand out markedly
